    Class
    Description
    static class 
    ClientSide.Application
    Singleton Static class that holds all the objects that need to be accessible from everywhere.
    class 
    ClientSide.Canvas
    Extends ClientSide.Component to represent a drawable canvas area where the drawing from the server is mirrored.
    class 
    ClientSide.Chat
    Represents a chat component in a graphical user interface, extending ClientSide.Component.
    class 
    ClientSide.Component
    Represents a basic graphical component for a user interface.
    class 
    ClientSide.Login
    Represents a login component in a graphical user interface, which extends ClientSide.Component.
    class 
    ClientSide.MessagePane
    Represents a message pane component, which extends ClientSide.Component.
    class 
    ClientSide.ScoreBoard
    Represents a scoreboard component in a graphical user interface, which extends ClientSide.Component.
    class 
    ClientSide.Session
    Manages user session details including the current user's information and a unique communication ID.
    class 
    ClientSide.User
    Represents a local user during system runtime.
    class 
    ClientSide.UserPane
    Represents a user pane component, which extends ClientSide.Component.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClientSide

      public ClientSide()

  • Method Details

    • setup

      void setup()
      Sets the properties of the GUI, initializes the different GUI components and establishes the server connection.

    • draw

      void draw()
      Main draw loop of the game. Updates current UI and responds to incoming server messages. Checks for server connectivity and sends heartbeats to signalise active user.

    • handleIncomingMessages

      public void handleIncomingMessages()
      Handles incoming messages from the server and redirects them to the corresponding methods.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game has ended.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise.

    • allowChatInteraction

      public void allowChatInteraction(boolean allowance)
      Enables or disables chat interaction based on the provided flag.
      Parameters:
      allowance - true to allow chat interaction, false to disable it.

    • showMessage

      public void showMessage(String message, boolean isCritical)
      Displays a message to the user.
      Parameters:
      message - The message to be displayed.
      isCritical - Indicates if the message is critical.

    • connectToServer

      public void connectToServer()
      Attempts to connect to the server. Notifies the user about the connection status through UI messages.

    • controlEvent

      public void controlEvent(controlP5.ControlEvent theEvent)
      Handles control events triggered by the user interface, such as button clicks. This method routes the actions based on the source of the event, identified by the controller's name.
      Parameters:
      theEvent - The control event captured by the system.

    • writeToServer

      public void writeToServer(String message)
      Sends a formatted message to the server in a specific format.
      Parameters:
      message - The raw message to be sent to the server.

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed()
      Handles key press events.
